name: Hippie Tribal Mexican Native Blanket Slouchy Boot Covers Leg Warmers Boho Biker Chic Saddle Blanket
description:
All handmade here in Santa Fe New Mexico!  

I love these I created them for the Winter season, these are slip on for western, regular leather boots, or normal shoes, I also use these over skinny jeans and granny boots. 

I think that these are great to use as covers on riding boots, as they will keep the dirt away from your boots, and they will match a nice horse saddle blanket.

Medium weight wide blanket adorned with fringe, can be tied on the front for a snug look, if your boots are narrower. 12 tall widest part top is 8", 6 bottom. There is a turquoise beads from where you pull the cord. Old conchos, western star buttons, shiva shell, hand charms, and fimo bead.

Made from a newer Mexican wool weaved blanket in beige, tans, browns and blacks.

name: Cross Body 'KILCHII' 'Red Boy' Navajo H Blanket Native Scout, Nomadic, Messenger Purse Bag
description:
Handmade suede fringes, 13x16 lining in black, with my name tag on it: MJK, little inside pocket. Closes with the antler tip as you pull the leather cord over it. Please feel free to inquire about any of my bags and jewelry!
The melody of each one is unique, and in tune to the beat of your fiery heart. 

More charms hanging like, metal red coral branch, old Chinese coin, old Kuchi medallion, hand made in my kilm brass eternity spiral, native rabbit concho, newer oval concho with stone, lots of hand cut sheepskin butter soft fringe, red suede wide strap, an up cycled item! Turquoise stones, deer horn tip. Middle Eastern crowie shells, glass + +

name: Bohemian Hippie Tribal, Nomadic, Unisex, Vintage, "Charna Island' Carpet Bag Messenger
description:
Charna or Churna Island is off the coast of Karachi is a small uninhabited Pakistani island located in the Arabian Sea, In Urdu: جزیرہ چرما.

So many little trinkets that will continue to amaze you every time you look at this awesome bag, some are to be discovered by you, some by others. Hand forged items, like the open lips, bells, prayer beads, Native pipe bones, turquoise shells and a big abalone round shell on the flap. It is unlined and has a little 'raw' pocket inside.

This is from my line of 'Carpet Baggers'. Ethnic, Eclectic and truly nomadic art. This is a medium weight bag. It is a perfect weekender bag for a beach retreat, just pack your bikini and sun protection lotion, the bag expands.

Handmade suede fringes, 13x18, woven leather strap hangs 16", outside leather cord hand stitches, with my name tag on it: MJK, Maritza James Kath. Over the inside pocket.

name: Organic Tribal African Old Spindle Whorl 'Krans' Necklace Pendant
description:
'Krans' which means Whorl in Afrikaans

Raw Tribal And Primitive Statement Piece.

Organically drapes and falls of your neck. It also has a Zen musical tone that I have designed to soothe your soul.

Hand made ceramic African whorl spindle, Maasai wood spear beads, animal vertebrae, glass beads, mussel shells, MOP, African Baule brass beads, ceramic raku pendant, cowrie shells, Kuchi coins, coconut, vintage tiny bells and leather cords. Mud cloth design whorl, Kashmiri meditation statement piece.

name: Medium Cross Body Navajo Fringe Blanket Native Scout Cross Roads Messenger Purse Bag
description:
From my Scout line, made from a hand woven, newer wool rug/blanket, with an old Navajo pattern. 

Wolf teeth adorn the side of bag, where the handmade black fringe hangs. A large concho on the side from where an African Baule old wax cast bead, a deer horn tip, mediterranean bell, small handmade chicken, and a heart with lips, made of copper by me from which a tiny bell hangs.

Perfect size, 10.5x13 lining in sturdy black cotton, with my name tag on it: MJK, small inside pocket. Leather strap, that hangs 20", a natural camel color deer leather around the opening of the bag. Bag is open on top for easy access, yet safe enough sitting against your body This is a very melodic bag!
